description: Erection of outbuilding to rear for use as a games room
decision_conditions: The proposed outbuilding would, by reason of its height, scale, bulk and mass appear as an unacceptably dominant and visually intrusive feature in the rear garden environment, harmful to the character and appearance of the surrounding area contrary to Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document, the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document and Policy D4 of the London Plan 2021.

The application does not provide sufficient information for the impact of the development on the trees adjacent to the southern site boundary, within the grounds of no. 8 Nelmes Road, to be fully considered and assessed.  In the absence of such information, the Local Planning Authority cannot be sure the development will not result in adverse impact on the trees within the adjacent site or assess the amenity impacts of this.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Mr Stuart Hall via email on the 08th June 2021.
